solution_line_template: Two dozens of pencils are equal to {num_dozens_pencils} x {items_per_dozen} = <<{num_dozens_pencils}*{items_per_dozen}={total_pencils}>>{total_pencils} pencils.
So the total cost of pencils is ${cost_per_pencil} x {total_pencils} = $<<{cost_per_pencil}*{total_pencils}={total_cost_pencils}>>{total_cost_pencils}.
The total cost of folders is ${cost_per_folder} x {num_folders} = $<<{cost_per_folder}*{num_folders}={total_cost_folders}>>{total_cost_folders}.
Thus, the cost to buy the office supplies is ${total_cost_pencils} + ${total_cost_folders} = $<<{total_cost_pencils}+{total_cost_folders}={total_office_supplies_cost}>>{total_office_supplies_cost}.
